officialTitle: Preoperative Radiotherapy Versus Postoperative Radiotherapy After Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy ("NeoRad") in High-risk Breast Cancer: a Prospektiv, Randomized, International Multicenter Phase III Trial
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Female
* Histopathological confirmation of breast cancer
* Indication for neoadjuvant chemotherapy
* Indication for radiotherapy
* Informed consent for NACT signed by the patient.
* T2-T4 a-d
* T1, if G3, triple negative, HER2 positive, or cN+/pN+
* Hormone receptor and HER2 status: no restrictions
* All grades G1-G3
* Age ≥18 years at the time of randomisation
* Performance status ≤ 2
* No pre-existing conditions that prohibit study therapy
* Signed consent form regarding registration, randomisation, collecting, and saving of personal data.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Pregnancy or lactation
* Prior radiotherapy of the affected or contralateral breast
* Connective tissue disease, including rheumatoid arthritis and thromboangiitis obliterans.
* Pre-existing symptomatic chronic lung disease (fibrosis, pneumoconiosis, adult-onset allergies such as farmer's lung, severe lung emphysema, COPD ≥°III)
* Cardiac comorbidities: symptomatic coronary heart disease, prior heart attack, heart failure NYHA ≥II or AHA ≥C, pacemaker and/ or implanted defibrillator
* Malignoma except for basalioma or in-situ-carcinomas in complete response
* Distant metastasis
* Plexopathies of the arm of the treated side
* Stiffness of the shoulder from any cause (e.g., after a car accident) of the arm of the side of the breast cancer
* Lymph edema ≥°II of the arm at the side of the breast cancer
* Missing signature on consent form
* Participation in other clinical trials
* Other medical conditions that prohibit the neoadjuvant chemotherapy (i.e., HIV, psychiatric diseases, noncompliance, etc.)
* Male patients
